Marathon Community Theatre- Your support makes a difference!
We extend our heartfelt gratitude to the individuals, businesses, and organizations whose generosity through grants and donations helps sustain our nonprofit mission. Your support enables us to continue enriching our community through the arts, education, and cultural programming. Together, we are making a lasting impact and keeping creativity alive for all to enjoy.

MEMBERSHIP HAS ITS BENEFITS!
BEST VALUED THEATRE MEMBERSHIP IN THE KEYS!
July 1, 2025 to June 30, 2026
INDIVIDUAL MEMBERSHIP (single person)
Basic Individual $50.00
Supporting Individual $100.00
Sustaining Individual: $500.00
FAMILY MEMBERSHIP (4 people in a household or family)
Basic Family $80.00
Supporting Family $160.00
Sustaining Family $600.00
STUDENT MEMBERSHIP
Student $15.00
Purchase your 2025/26 Season Membership NEW BENEFITS!!!!
For details on each membership see below or contact our Box Office at 305.743.0994
CHOOSE YOUR MEMBERSHIP LEVEL
Your 2025/2026 Membership Benefits Include:
INDIVIDUAL MEMBERSHIP
BASIC:
Access to Monthly newsletters and updates on upcoming productions.
$5 discount to all Main-Stage productions, limited 2 discounted tickets per production.
10% discount on Murder Mystery, limited 2 discounted tickets
Voting rights at membership meetings.
FREE Dance Classes
SUPPORTING:
ALL the benefits of
BASIC
, but 4 discount ticket limit per production.
Recognition in ALL Main-Stage Playbills
NEW-
Discount participating Restaurant card
SUSTAINING:
ALL, benefits of
SUPPORTING
.
Recognition on our dedicated donor wall in theatre lobby.
2 COMPLIMENTARY tickets to ALL Main-Stage productions for the membership year.
2 COMPLIMENTARY tickets to OWO (One Weekend Only)
FAMILY MEMBERSHIP
BASIC:
Access to Monthly newsletters and updates on upcoming productions.
$5 discount to all Main-Stage productions, limited 4 discounted tickets per production.
10%  discount on Murder Mystery & Summer Children's Production, limited 4 discounted tickets.
Voting rights at membership meetings.
FREE dance classes
SUPPORTING:
ALL, benefits of
BASIC
, but 8 discounted ticket limit per production.
Recognition in ALL Main-Stage playbills.
NEW-
Discount participating Restaurant card.
SUSTAINING:
ALL, benefits of
SUPPORTING
.
Recognition on our dedicated donor wall in theatre lobby.
2 COMPLIMENTARY tickets to ALL Main-Stage productions for the membership year.
2 COMPLIMENTARY tickets to OWO (One Weekend Only)
STUDENT MEMBERSHIP
Access to Monthly newsletters and updates on upcoming productions.
$5 discount to all Main-Stage productions, limited to 1 discounted ticket.
10% discount on Murder Mystery and Summer Children's production, limited 1 discounted ticket.
FREE dance classes
*All complimentary and discounted tickets are on a space available basis in the playhouse or gallery.
BECOME A MEMBER
HAVE WE GOT A SEASON FOR YOU!
MAIN-STAGE SHOW 1 - ROCKY HORROR SHOW
SEPTEMBER 2025 | Full-Length Play | Musical Sci-Fi Comedy
Book, Music and Lyrics by Richard O'Brien
MAIN-STAGE SHOW 2 - THE WIZARD OF OZ
NOVEMBER 2025 | Full-Length Play | Musical
Written By L. Frank Baum
MAIN-STAGE SHOW 3 - THE ODD COUPLE
JANUARY 2026| Full-Length | Comedy
Written by Neil Simon
MAIN-STAGE SHOW 4 - LITTLE SHOP OF HORRORS
FEBRUARY 2026 | Full-Length Play | Musical Sci-Fi Comedy
Written By: Howard Ashman
MAIN-STAGE SHOW 5 - WAIT UNTIL DARK
APRIL 2026 | Full-Length Play | Drama
SELECTED YOUR MEMBERSHIP, NOW CHOOSE A SHOW PACKAGE:
DISCOUNTED TICKET PACKS FOR MEMBERS ONLY!
INSTRUCTIONS:
Have a current 25/26 membership - which became available to purchase on July 1, 2025? Can't remember if you renewed yet?  Please call the Box Office at 305-743-0994 or stop by M-F 12pm-4pm and we will be glad to check for you as well as complete any purchases for your season via phone or in person.  Personal service with a smile!
If you know you have a current membership, please SKIP STEP 2 and go to STEP 3.
If you do not have a 25/26 membership or have not renewed your membership yet, please
COMPLETELY READ & FOLLOW
the instructions below or you may contact our Box Office and we can complete your transactions for you:
Step 1:  CLICK ON THE PACKAGE BUTTON BELOW
Step 2:  CHOOSE YOUR MEMBERSHIP LEVEL
Once you select your Membership Level click NEXT STEP
- DO NOT PRESS CHECKOUT YET!
Step 3:  CHOOSE THE  PACKAGE OF YOUR CHOICE
You choose your desired shows, seats and show dates all in one purchase.  With multiple show combinations, there's package suited for everyone!  Which one will you choose?
Your 2025/2026 PACKAGES:
25/26 5-PACK (Shows 1/2/3/4/5) $ 37.50 DISCOUNT
Discounted tickets to all FIVE Main-Stage Shows
25/26 4-PACK A (Shows 1/2/3/4) $ 32.00 DISCOUNT
Discounted tickets to shows 1,2,3,4 Main-Stage Shows
25/26 4-PACK B (Shows 2/3/4/5) $28.00 DISCOUNT
Discounted tickets to shows 2,3,4,5 Main-Stage Shows
25/26 3-PACK A (Shows 2/3/4) $21.00 DISCOUNT
Discounted tickets to shows 2,3,4 Main-Stage Shows
25/26 3-PACK B (Shows 3/4/5) $21.00 DISCOUNT
Discounted tickets to shows 3,4,5 Main-Stage Shows
Once you select your ticket pack(s) click NEXT STEP
BUY A PACKAGE
25/26 5-PACK (Shows 1/2/3/4/5) $ 37.50  ALL FIVE Main-Stage Shows
25/26 4-PACK A (Shows 1/2/3/4) $ 32.00 DISCOUNT SHOWS  1,2,3,4
25/26 4-PACK B (Shows 2/3/4/5) $28.00  DISCOUNT                      SHOWS  2,3,4,5
25/26 3-PACK A (Shows 2/3/4) $21.00  DISCOUNT SHOWS 2,3,4
25/26 3-PACK B (Shows 3/4/5) $21.00 DISCOUNT  SHOWS 3,4,5

Welcome to Marathon Community Theatre
About Our Venue
Marathon Community Theatre (MCT) is located in Marathon, Florida - the heart of the Florida Keys - at 5101 Overseas Hwy (Mile Marker 49.5 Ocean Side).  We are the ONLY Community Theatre located in Monroe County and house the ONLY Theatre and Cinema within a 50 mile radius.
Marathon Community Theatre is a 501(c)(3) not for profit organization that is operated by a fully volunteer Board of Directors with a small paid staff.
Beginning in 1944 as a traveling troupe called the Marathon Little Theatre, our organization held its early productions at restaurants, hotels, City Hall and even the local High School.  For just over 50-years, tents and travel trailers assembled in parking lots acted as the Backstage where actors donned their costumes and got into their make-up.  By the early nineties the MCT Board of Directors, our General Membership and the local community came together to raise the funds needed to purchase our current venue -
which has been Marathon's primary entertainment center - originally housing the Plaza Lounge, The Side Door Lounge and the Middle Keys only movie theatre - The Marathon Cinema.
Marathon Community Theatre
volunteers set to work renovating the building, creating the treasured theatre you find today, opening the 1996 theatrical season with
Man of La Mancha
.  Over the past 80-years
Marathon Community Theatre
has striven to create a true Cultural Arts Center, revamping the movie theatre to provide up-to-date digital films and sound (2013), paying off the original building mortgage (2016), completing major repairs sustained from Hurricane Irma (2017), installing a new digital lighting system in the theatre's main auditorium (2019) and the replacement of three commercial HVAC systems in 2020.  Recently the Marathon Community Theatre retained management and staffing of the newly named
Marathon Community Cinema
after over twelve years of leasing to outside tenants.  The
Marathon Community Cinema
reopened to the public in mid February 2021, after the cinema’s 11-month closure due to the 2020 Pandemic.
The
Marathon Community Theatre
offers four major main-stage productions per season (which runs July through June), fine art exhibitions in our gallery, weekly dance classes for current theatre members, annual holiday events, fundraisers and variety shows, gallery and main-stage readings, guest performances and concerts, an annual community dance showcase and a six week Summer Theatre Camp for children ages 6 to 18 years old.
The
Marathon Community Theater
cast members, crew members and volunteers are unique to our area - an odd collection of boaters, postal workers, lawyers, office and retail workers, construction laborers and even a few local dolphin trainers.  Membership ranges from tweens to grandmas, pigtails to balding patterns, high tops to bunions.  It’s not uncommon to see an 80-year-old tap dancing across the
MCT
stage or a local child with unknown talent wowing the audience.  All of the members on-stage and behind-the-scenes are volunteers, with an eclectic blend of loveable misfits bringing their outstanding talent to you in our little corner of paradise – The Fabulous Florida Keys!
A Variety of Events
The Marathon Community Theatre
offers multiple events throughout the entire year, including four main-stage theatrical productions, intimate gallery readings, public art shows, concerts, community dance showcases, annual variety show fundraiser, children's summer theatre program and multiple special events.
Private Rentals
The Marathon Community Theatre
has multiple spaces available for rent. In the past we have hosted dance classes, music concerts, theatrical events, business and organization meetings and private parties - even hosting a few weddings right on our main-stage!  If you are interested in renting a space at
Marathon Community Theatre or Marathon Community Cinema
, please contact our General Manager at
gm@marathontheater.org
for our pricing and rental information.
Marathon Community Theatre's Mission Statement
Our aim is to produce engaging, inspiring, high quality theatrical productions that entertain our diverse community of local citizens, seasonal residents and large tourist population; train and support the next generation of theatre artists; provide arts education programs that promote life-long learning to our local community; and celebrate the essential power of the arts to illuminate our common humanity.
MCT BOARD OF DIRECTORS
